Property destruction: Around 2 September 2024 (as reported), according to the Security Service and the Police, a 35-year-old man, together with two other men, aged 25 and 30, all previously convicted, set fire to five military vehicles in Kherson (coded separately), Mykolaiv (coded separately), and Odesa, following commands from Russian special services. The police seized storage units, two handguns, a machine gun, 12 grenades and ammunition from the suspects.
On 3 September 2024, explosions were heard in Odesa, Odesa, likely from Russian missile strike. Casualties unknown.
On 4 September 2024, explosions were heard (likely due to Russia Forces launching ballistic missiles strikes) in the area of Odesa, Odesa. Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 8 September 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missiles and drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).

Interception: On 10 September 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian Shahed drones above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) 18 drones were shot down above Kyiv, Vinnytsia, Chernihiv, Kirovgrad, Mykolaiv, Odesa, Kherson, Sumy, Dnipropetrovsk, Kharkiv, Zaporizhia, and Poltava Oblasts.
On 12 September 2024, explosions were heard in the area of Odesa, Odesa (suspectedly due to Russian drone strikes in the area). No casualties.

On 13 September 2024, Russian forces launched a drone strike at Odesa, Odesa region. One civilian was injured. 16 drones were intercepted by Ukrainian forces. The falling debris in Odesa and the region damaged four garages, glazing in 20 private residential buildings, four cars and two extensions to residential buildings.

Property destruction: Around 13 September 2024 (as reported), according to the SBU, four men, including two 16-year-olds, a 17-year-old, and a 22-year-old IDP, set fire to six military vehicles throughout several districts of the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa), following commands from representatives of Russian Federation (coded as FSB). The men were quickly arrested after the arsons.
Interception: On 14 September 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down 27 Russian drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).
On 14 September 2024, Russian forces launched ''Iskander-M' ballistic missiles near Odesa. 2 civilians were killed and 1 civilian was injured.

On 15 September 2024, Russian forces launched airborne 'Kh-59' missiles and 2 'Iskander-M' ballistic missiles at Odesa region (coded to Odesa). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian 1 'Kh-59' missiles and 10 Russian 'Shahed' drones.

Property destruction: Around 15 September 2024 (between 1 August - 21 October), according to the SBU, three men, aged 20, 24, and 20, set fire to at least eight railway cabinets in the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa), following commands from Russian special services (coded as FSB).

On 20 September 2024, Russian Forces launched an 'Iskander-M' ballistic missile at Odesa, Odesa, damaging a port infrastructure in Odesa city, and an Antigua-flagged civilian vessel moored at the port. 4 civilians loading the vessel were injured. One of the injured civilians later died in a hospital. Also, on 23 September 2024, it became known that the Ukrainian commander of a maritime security ship was killed as a result of the Russian missile strike.

Weapons seizure: Around 23 September 2024 (as reported), the Security Service dismantled a sleeping cell of 20 men affiliated to Russian GRU and seized from them around 70 arms and weapons, munition, vests, and other tactical equipment. The cell, led by a 49-year-old Crimea resident, was instructed to take over government institutions in Odesa.
On 24 September 2024, Russian forces launched an air strike with Kh-59 missiles and drones at Odesa, Odesa region. Casualties unknown.
On 25 September 2024, Russian air forces struck in the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa), damaging 2 trucks. The Ukrainian military intercepted 3 missiles. There were no casualties.

On 26 September 2024, Russian Forces launched 78 Shahed-136/131 drones against targets in Ukraine and four Kh-59/69 cruise missiles against targets in Odesa. Ukrainian Forces intercepted 66 drones, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa) and shot down all four Kh-59/69 missiles. The fallen debris of the downed drones and missiles damaged houses and cars. 1 civilian was killed.
On 27 September 2024, Russian air forces carried out airstrikes at Odesa, Odesa. Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 29 September 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down a Russian drone over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).
On 29 September 2024, Russian air forces carried out drone strikes near Odesa. No casualties.
Interception: On 1 October 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted a Russian Iskander-M missile near Odesa, Odesa. No casualties.
On 2 October 2024, Russian air forces carried out drone strikes at Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 3 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian Shahed drones above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) 78 drones were shot down above Kyiv, Cherkasy, Vinnytsia, Khmelnytskyi, Kirovgrad, Zhytomyr, Poltava, Chernihiv, Odesa, Kharkiv, Sumy, Dnipropetrovsk, Rivne, and Ivano-Frankivsk Oblasts.
Interception: On 5 October 2024, Ukrainian forces intercepted several Russian Shahed drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa region).

On 6 October 2024, Russian forces launched missiles and carried out drone strikes at Odesa region (coded to Odesa). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones. Civilian infrastructure and a trade ship were damaged. 1 civilian was injured.

On 7 October 2024, Russian Forces struck a Palau-flagged ship in the port of Odesa, Odesa, with a missile. A Ukrainian employee of a private cargo-handling company was killed, 5 foreign nationals were injured.

Interception: On 10 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) 41 Russian Shahed drones were shot down above Mykolaiv, Odesa, Kherson, Kyiv, Cherkasy, Sumy, Poltava, Zaporizhia, Donetsk, and Dnipropetrovsk Oblasts.
On 10 October 2024, Russian forces conducted a strike with an airborne Kh-31P missile in Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) Casualties unknown.

Property destruction: Around 11 October 2024 (as reported), three men set fire to a military van and a signal cabinet in and near Odesa, following Russian security commands (coded as FSB). The men were quickly arrested.

On 12 October 2024, Russian forces launched an Iskander-M missile strike at Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa region). Ukrainian forces intercepted the missile, but the debris injured an unknown number of civilians.
On 13 October 2024, Russian forces launched 'Kalibr' missiles and carried out drone strikes at Odesa region (coded to Odesa). Unspecified number of civilians were injured.

On 14 October 2024, Russian Forces struck the port of Odesa with a ballistic missile, hitting the civilians vessel NS Moon flying the Belize flag and the Optima dry cargo vessel flying the Palau flag (the Optima vessel was already damaged by a strike on October 7), as well as port infrastructure and a grain warehouse. 1 civilian, who worked on a deck of one of the vessels, was killed and 8 more civilians were injured.

Interception: On 15 October 2024, Russian Forces launched 17 unspecified strike drones (suspected Shahed-136/131 drones) at targets in Ukraine. 12 drones were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa) and 4 more attack drone became lost in Ukraine due to Ukrainian electronic warfare countermeasures. No casualties.

Interception: On 17 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) 22 Russian drones were shot down and 27 were disrupted and likely destroyed by EW systems in Sumy, Kyiv, Poltava, Chernihiv, Zhytomyr, Mykolaiv, Cherkasy, Odesa, and Ternopil Oblasts.
Interception: On 18 October 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 80 Russian drones, some over the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa).
On 18 October 2024, Russian air forces fired missiles, suspectedly Kh-59, at Odesa, Odesa, damaging residential buildings. There were no casualties.
Interception: On 20 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).
On 20 October 2024, Russian forces launched missiles at Odesa. Russian missiles struck port areas and damaged oil infrastructure. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 21 October 2024, Russian forces launched one Iskander-M/North Korean KN-23 ballistic missile, one Kh-35 and one Kh-31P missile, and 116 strike drones (including Shahed-136/131s) drones against the targets in Ukraine. 59 drones were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa) and 45 drones were 'lost,' possibly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) countermeasures. No casualties.

Property destruction: Around 22 October 2024, according to the police, a 40-year-old man and a 34-year-old man set fire to an electrical substation in Khadzhybeyskyi district of the city of Odesa, Odesa, following promises of money from a messenger app. The men were later arrested.

Interception: On 24 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down six Russian drones above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa). 40 Russian drones were shot down above Odesa, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Vinnytsia, Zhytomyr, Khmelnytskyi, Cherkasy, Kirovgrad, Kyiv, Poltava, and Chernihiv Oblasts.
Interception: On 25 October 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 36 Russian kamikaze-drones over multiple locations, some over the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa).
Interception: On 27 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).
On 29 October 2024, Russian Forces launched two Kh-31P guided aerial missiles at Odesa, Odesa that were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces. The fallen debris of the downed missiles killed a civilian.

Property destruction: Around 29 October 2024, according to the police, a 42-year-old man set fire to the door of an apartment of a civilian in Odesa, Odesa, following commands from a messenger app (likely following Russian commands).
On 30 October 2024, Russian forces launched a missile strike at Odesa, Odesa. Casualties unknown.

On 31 October 2024, Russian forces conducted a strike with an unidentified weapons system (coded as air/drone strike) on a fire department in Odesa, Odesa. The station and vehicles were damaged. Two firefighters were injured.

Interception: On 31 October 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones and missiles above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) 2 Kh-59/69 were shot down above Odesa. 17 Russian drones were shot down above Cherkasy, Odesa, Kyiv, Kirovohrad, Dnipropetrovsk, Donetsk, and Poltava Oblasts. 23 other drones had undetermined statuses and were potentially misdirected with EW systems.
Interception: On 1 November 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down 31 Russian drones and 3 Kh-type missiles, some of them over the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa region). No casualties.
Interception: On 3 November 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).

Interception: On 5 November 2024, Russian Forces launched two Kh-59/69 cruise missiles towards Odesa. The missiles were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces in Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). No casualties.

On 7 November 2024, debris from Russian Shahed drones crashed into a residential building and damaged the building, gas pipelines, and cars around the building in Odesa, Odesa. A civilian was wounded.

Interception: On 7 November 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones, including Shahed drones, above Odesa Oblast (coded to Odesa, Odesa.) 74 Russian drones were destroyed and 25 others were misdirected or lost above Mykolaiv, Kherson, Kyiv, Sumy, Poltava, Kharkiv, Kirovgrad, Zhytomyr, Cherkasy, and Chernihiv Oblasts.

Interception: On 8 November 2024, at night, Ukrainian air defense forces shot down in total 4 Russian 'Kh-59/69' type cruise missiles and 62 attack drones over the multiple locations, some over the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa region). Also, 23 more Russian drones were lost likely due to Ukrainian EW systems. No casualties.

On 8 November 2024, at night, Russian forces carried out massive airstrikes with 'Shahed-136' drones at unidentified targets in Odesa, Odesa region. As a result of the drone strikes, several high-rise buildings, houses in the private sector, administrative buildings, warehouses and cars were damaged. Also, at least 9 civilians were injured and 1 civilian was killed. On the same day, in the late evening, Russian forces launched a drone strike at Odesa. There were at least 5 explosives, residential houses, shops and cars were damaged. 1 civilian was killed, 13 civilians were injured.

On 9 November 2024, Russian air forces carried out drone strikes at Odesa. As a result of the strike, 25 garages, 2 cars, 9 trucks, 10 kiosks, 2 shops, 6 private residential buildings (2 of which were destroyed), and a gas station, were damaged. 2 civilians were injured.
Interception: On 10 November 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Odesa region (coded to Odesa).

On 14 November 2024, Russian drones and air-based missiles struck Odesa, Odesa, damaging a church, a school, objects of heating infrastructure, residential buildings, a port and an architectural object under protection of UNESCO. 1 civilian was killed, 10 wounded.

Interception: On 15 November 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted an Kh-59/69 missile and 25 Russian kamikaze-drones over several locations, a missile and of most of drones over the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). Ukrainian coast defence intercepted 4 Russian kamikaze-drones over the Odesa region.

On 17 November 2024, Russian forces launched missiles at energy infrastructure in Odesa region (coded to Odesa). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones and missiles . 2 civilians were killed and 1 civilian was injured.

On 18 November 2024, debris from a downed Russian Iskander-M ballistic missile damaged a multi-story residential building, a university, and an administrative building in Odesa, Odesa. 11 people, including 7 policemen and a medical worker, were killed and 54 civilians were injured.
Property destruction: On 18 November 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted a Russian Orlan-10 reconnaissance drone near Odesa, Odesa. No casualties.

Property destruction: Around 19 November 2024 (as reported), according to the SBU and the police, two men, aged 15 and 20, set fire to an Ukrposhta office in Odesa and in Mykolaiv (coded separately), following Russian commands. The men were arrested together with a 17-year-old man involved in an explosion in Kyiv (coded separately).

On 25 November 2024, Russian Forces struck Odesa, Odesa, with Iskander missiles, damaging 25 apartment buildings, cars, a school, a university, a dental clinic and other civilian buildings. 12 civilians were injured.

Interception: On 25 November 2024, Russian Forces launched 145 Shahed and unspecified strike drones at targets in Ukraine. Ukrainian Forces intercepted 71 drones, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). 71 more Russian drones were lost in Ukrainian airspace suspectedly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference. No casualties.
Defusal: On 25 November 2024, a grenade was discovered in a park in Odesa, Odesa, by passers-by. The grenade was removed from the park likely by State Emergency Service of Ukraine. No casualties.

Interception: On 26 November 2024, Russian Forces launched a record number of drones against Ukraine - 188 Shahed and other unspecified drones (suspectedly decoy drones). Ukrainian Forces intercepted 76 drones, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). 95 more Russian drones were lost in Ukrainian airspace suspectedly due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference. No casualties.
Property destruction: On 26 November 2024, Russian Forces intercepted Russian reconnaissance drone over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). No casualties.

On 28 November 2024, debris from Russian missile crashed in Odesa, Odesa, causing fires in a field and a garage. 18 private houses, gas pipelines, and farm buildings were damaged. Three civilians were wounded.

On 29 November 2024, Russian kamikaze drones struck three settlements in the Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa), damaging residential buildings and wounding 7 civilians. Ukrainian military forces intercepted 88 Russian kamikaze-drones across several locations, 18 over the Odesa region.
Interception: On 3 December 2024, Ukrainian Forces intercepted 22 Russian drones, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). No casualties.
Defusal: On 3 December 2024, State Emergency Service of Ukraine defused a sea mine that washed ashore in Odesa region, Odesa. No casualties.

Property destruction: Around 4 December 2024 (as reported), according to the police, a 15-year-old boy tried to set fire to a substation in Odesa, Odesa, following commands from an individual from social media (likely from Russia). The boy was quickly arrested after the arson.

Property destruction: On 8 December 2024, according to the police, a 20-year-old man set fire to an SUV in Odesa, Odesa, following commands from orders from an individual from social media (likely from Russia).

Interception: On 9 December 2024, Russian Forces launched two Kh-59/69 cruise missiles and 37 Shahed and other unspecified drones at targets in Ukraine. Ukrainian Forces intercepted two Russian Kh-59/69 cruise missiles and 18 Russian drones, some of them over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). 18 more drones were lost, likely due to Ukrainian electronic warfare (EW) interference or faulty drone components. No casualties.

On 13 December 2024, Ukrainian border guards intercepted 4 Russian drones, including a reconnaissance drone, and some missiles over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa). The debris damaged a logistic company. There were no casualties.
Interception: On 14 December 2024, Ukrainian air defence forces intercepted several Russian missiles over Odesa region (coded to Odesa, Odesa region).

Weapons seizure: On 13 March 2018, Police Forces of Ukraine seized 2 grenade launchers - RPG-22 and RPG-26, 19 grenades (F-1, RGD-5, RGN), two pistols and a foreign-made machine gun, ammunition and 2 TNT charge in Chernihiv region. Three people, acting in a cooperation with the members of the Military Forces of Ukraine, established a scheme for stealing weapons and ammunition from the ATO zone, were arrested.

Weapons seizure: On 22 March 2018, the Security Service of Ukraine, in association with a prosecutor's office, has exposed a group in Chernihiv whose members, acting on the orders of the Russian security services, were committing crimes aimed at stoking interethnic hatred and tarnishing Ukraine's international image. When law enforcers searched the properties of the offenders, they seized eight sticks of dynamite, five RGD-5 grenades, melee weapons, anti-Ukrainian symbols and other materials proving their illegal activity.

On 30 August 2019, unidentified people attacked and beat a journalist in Chernihiv who was accusing deputies of the regional council of corruption and high treason. The journalist suffered a concussion.
On 24 February 2022, Russian forces clashed with Ukrainian forces near Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 25 February 2022, Russian forces fired artillery at a functioning hospital and Ukrainian Secret Service building in Chernihiv. Casialties unknown.
On 25 February 2022, 2 shells launched by Russian military forces hit the Security Service of Ukraine Office in Chernihiv, Chernihiv oblast, causing severe damage and fire. There were no casualties.
On 25 February 2022, Russian forces clashed with Ukrainian forces near Chernihiv. Failing to capture the city, Russian forces decided to bypass Chernihiv and move towards Kyiv. Casualties unknown.

On 26 February 2022, Russian military forces launched a BM-21 Grad multiple rocket launchers and tanks at Chernihiv, hitting the residential buildings and kindergartens. Casualties unknown. The commander that ordered a tank crew to fire a 125mm shell at a residential multi-apartment house on the outskirts of Chernihiv was later exchanged under a prisoner swap before receiving a guilty verdict for committing a war crime.
On 26 February 2022, Ukrainian military forces launched an artillery and missile attack on an Russian military convoy in Chernihiv region. Casualties unknown.

On 27 February 2022, the Russian military forces carried out air strikes and shelled with heavy weaponry the city of Chernihiv, damaging 6 residential buildings, including a children's dental clinic and kindergarten. Russian troops also launched a missile attack on the center of the city. Two Ukrainian soldiers were killed. Also, 16 civilians sustained various degree injuries.

On 28 February 2022, the Russian military forces launched rockets and shelled with heavy weapons Chernihiv, targeting residential houses, kindergartens, shops, and wounding civilians. Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: On 28 February 2022, Ukrainian forces (of Operational Command 'north'), in their area of operation, captured four Russian trucks with munition left by the Russian military following their offensive in the Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).
Movement of forces: On 1 March 2022, Belarusian troops entered Ukrainian territory in Chernihiv region, formally joining the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

On 1 March 2022, Russian Military forces fired Grad missiles at the Masany district and the Peace boulevard in Chernihiv. A unexploded missile was removed. Russian forces also hit with Iskander missiles the Ukrainian Operational Command North HQ. Casualties unknown.
On 1 March 2022, Russian forces hit with Iskander missiles and destroyed Ukrainian forces and fuel storage in the Chernihiv region. There were fatalities among the Ukrainian troops coded as 10.
On 2 March 2022, Russian forces shelled a police department and a hospital administrative building in Chernihiv, killing one person and injuring five.

On 3 March 2022, the Russian military forces launched an airstrike in the city of Chernihiv, Ukraine. Civilian infrastructures were hit as well as the 'Astra Plant', which stores petroleum products, as a result of which fire broke out. 47 civilians were killed.
On 4 March 2022, the Russian military forces launched an airstrike on the city Chernihiv, Ukraine. As a result, 33 civilians were killed and 18 injured.
On 5 March 2022, the Russian military forces clashed with Ukrainian forces outside of Chernihiv. Two people were wounded.

On 5 March 2022, Ukrainian military forces, using the Igla-1 man-portable air defence system, shot down Russian Su-35 aircraft in Chernihiv region. The crew ejected. The navigator of the enemy aircraft died, the pilot was captured.

On 5 March 2022, the Russian military forces shelled Chernihiv, hitting residential buildings. Ukrainian regional command claims Russian forces used 'unmanned FAB-500 bombs indiscriminately on residential targets'. Casualties unknown.

On 5 March 2022, according to Ukrainian MoD, following downing of a Russian SU-35 aircraft in the Chernihiv region, the ejected pilot, while trying to escape after ejecting, killed a local civilian man who tried to chase him. Nevertheless, the pilot was later captured by the Ukrainian military and handed over to the Ukrainian law enforcement.

Defusal: On 6 March 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists found and defused three unexploded Russian FAB-500 aerial bombs at the private house in Chernihiv (Chernihiv). According to local sources, those aerial bombs were left over from downed SU-34 the day before.
On 6 March 2022, the Russian military forces clashed with Ukrainian forces outside of Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 6 March 2022, the Russian military forces shelled Chernihiv, hitting residential buildings. Russian forces also used unmanned bombs. Casualties unknown.
On 7 March 2022, the Russian military forces clashed with Ukrainian forces near Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 9 March 2022, Russian military clashed with Ukrainian territorial defense forces near Chernihiv, suffering casualties and losses of military vehicles. Uspecified fatalities coded as 10.
On 9 March 2022, the Russian military forces opened fire at a group of civilians who were trying to leave the city of Chernihiv. Four people were killed, three were wounded.
On 9 March 2022, Russia forces fired 152mm artillery in central Chernihiv, setting 10 houses of fire. Casualties unknown.
Defusal: On 9 March 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists safely defused a Russian aerial bomb and other UXOs in Chernihiv city, Chernihiv region.

On 10 March 2022, clashes took place between Russian forces and Ukrainian forces in the Chernihiv region. As a result, Ukrainian forces seized 10 Russian tanks. Additionally, in the same region, Ukrainian servicemen destroyed Russian Iskander-M Missile Complex Division. Casualties unknown.
On 10 March 2022, Russian forces shelled Chernihiv as a result of which a football stadium was destroyed as well as almost the whole city was left without gas and electricity. Casualties unknown.
On 10 March 2022, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian Su-25 aircraft in the Chernihiv region. The pilot died.
On 11 March 2022, the Russian military shelled civilian infrastructure like the Gagarin Stadium in Chernihiv. As a result, at least 2 civilians died and 2 were wounded.
On 11 March 2022, Ukrainian forces shot down two Russian Su-34 aircraft around Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

On 11 March 2022, fighting took place between Russian forces and Ukrainian forces near Chernihiv. The Ukrainian side reports that during the clashes the Russian forces lost 9 tanks, 1 APC, 1 IFV, and around 50 Russian servicemen were killed.

On 12 March 2022, Russian forces throughout the whole day conducted airstrikes and shelled Chernihiv with heavy weapons, hitting residential buildings. One of the shells hit the Ukraine Hotel. Casualties unknown.
On 12 March 2022, the Ukrainian military forces destroyed a Russian Msta-C howitzer near Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
Defusal: On 12 March 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists conducted a controlled detonation of a Russian aerial bomb (FAB-500) in the Chernihiv region.

On 13 March 2022, Russian forces throughout the whole day conducted airstrikes and shelled Chernihiv with heavy weapons, hitting residential buildings. One of the shells hit a dormitory. Seven people were rescued, one person died, further casualties unknown.
On 13 March 2022, Ukrainian forces shot down one Russian aircraft around Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

On 14 March 2022, Russian forces fired MLRS and missiles at water pumping station in the outskirts of Chernihiv (Chernihiv). As a result of shelling, 1 worker at the plant along with four family members (they were sheltering there) were killed. Moreover, the water reservoir, the control room, the treatment tank and the pumping station were severely damaged. According to local sources, Russian military were deliberately targeting the water pumping station in order to cut the residents off the clean water supply.

On 14 March 2022, in the Chernihiv region, Ukrainian soldiers destroyed by shelling the command post of Russian forces. The Ukrainian side reported numerous casualties among the Russians, but no exact number was given. Unspecified fatalities coded as 10.
On 14 March 2022, Russian forces fired with heavy weapons at the civilian infrastructure of Chernihiv including university, market and residential houses. 10 people died.
Around 15 March 2022 (month of), Russian forces attacked the Chernihiv region as a result of which 2 civilians were killed. Their bodies were found under the rubble on April 28.
On 15 March 2022, Russian military forces shelled the outskirts of Chernihiv, Chernihiv with cluster munitions. 2 civilians were wounded.

On 15 March 2022, Ukrainian military discovered and destroyed a battery of Russian multiple rocket launchers near Chernihiv, Chernihiv, while the Russian military shot down 2 Ukrainian SU-25 aircrafts. There were also other clashes between two sides in the area, involving the volunteer defense forces. At least one Ukrainian soldier died, further casualties unknown.

On 16 March 2022, Russian forces fired with cluster munitions on civilians waiting in line for bread at Dotsenka Street in Desniansky district of Chernihiv. 14 people were killed, 26 were injured. Among the dead was an American citizen living in Ukraine. Russian forces also damaged a children's hospital and the central part of the city.
On 16 March 2022, Ukrainian military forces shot down a Russian military plane in Chernihiv, Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

On 16 March 2022, Ukrainian forces clashed with a Russian sabotage group wearing Ukrainian uniforms that infiltrated into the territory of a skiing facility in Chernihiv, Chernihiv region. At least 1 Ukrainian soldier was killed by an explosive.

On 17 March 2022, Russian forces conducted air strikes and used heavy artillery against the city of Chernihiv. Multiple civilian infrastructures were hit. A family of five was killed in an air strike on a dormitory.

On 17 March 2022, Ukrainian forces through an artillery attack destroyed an ammunition warehouse and gas reserves of Russian forces in the Chernihiv region. It is estimated that a tens of Russian servicemen were killed during the attack. Unspecified fatalities coded as 10.
On 18 March 2022, Russian forces shelled streets in Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 18 March 2022, Ukrainian forces clashed with Russian forces near Chernihiv, destroying a Tor missile system and a command center. Casualties unknown.

On 19 March 2022, Russian forces shelled Chernihiv, hitting a hospital. The city mayor informed that all the glass was broken out and patients were lying in the corridors at cold temperatures. There were no casualties.
On 19 March 2022, Ukrainian military forces attacked Russian batteries of Uragan multiple rocket launchers and 2C19 MSTA-S self-propelled artillery systems in Chernihiv region. Casualties unknown.
On 20 March 2022, Russians shelled various areas of the city of Chernihiv. Artillery fire struck a civilian car delivering water, killing two and injuring two. Further casualties unknown.
On 20 March 2022, Ukrainian forces destroyed Russian army supply truck in Chernihiv region. Casualties unknown.

Around 20 March 2022 (between 10 March - 31 March), Russian soldiers were residing in a civilian house in a village in Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region) for 3 weeks, while one of the soldiers was sexually assaulting a 16-year-old girl in that household. Her relatives were also threatened and physically assaulted.

On 20 March 2022, Russian forces clashed with a Ukrainian reconnaissance and sabotage group in Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region). Ukrainian soldiers were taken captive, held as prisoners in different locations and subsequently released under a prisoner swap.
On 21 March 2022, Russian forces shelled Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: On 21 March 2022, Ukrainian forces (of Operational Command 'North'), in their area of operation, found a Russian '2S19' self-propelled howitzer left by the Russian military following their defeat. One more similar howitzer was destroyed in the Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).
On 22 March 2022, Russian forces shelled Chernihiv. Civilian infrastructure was damaged including a factory that used ammonia. Casualties unknown.
On 23 March 2022, the Russian air forces dropped bombs on a bridge near Chernihiv that was used for evacuation of civilians. No casualties.
On 23 March 2022, Ukrainian forces shelled Russian positions in Chernihiv region [coded to Chernihiv]. As a result of the shelling, Russian military vehicle was destroyed. Casualties unknown.
On 23 March 2022, Russian special forces of an unidentified unit/branch raided Ukrainian positions in Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 23 March 2022, Russian air defense intercepted Ukrainian drones near Chernihiv, Chernihiv. Russian sources reported interception of 9 drones near Kyiv, Izium, Kharkiv, Chernihiv, and Sumy.
On 24 March 2022, Russian forces dropped bombs and shelled Chernihiv throughout the whole night. Casualties unknown.
On 24 March 2022, Ukrainian forces destroyed two Tiger armored vehicles, a tank and KamAZ belonging to the Russian forces in the Chernihiv region. Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: On 24 March 2022, Ukrainian forces (of Operational Command 'North'), in their area of operation, found three units of Russian military equipment i.e., 1 APC, 1 IFV (BMP-2), 1 armored vehicle left by the Russian military following their defeat (coded to Chernihiv).
On 25 March 2022, Russian forces abducted around 11 civilians from the Chernihiv region.

On 25 March 2022, Ukrainian forces clashed with Russian forces in the Siversk historical region of the Chernihiv region. During the day, Ukrainian forces destroyed another Russian column. Casualties unknown.

On 26 March 2022, fighting occurred between Russian and Ukrainian military forces in Chernihiv region, as a result of which Ukrainian forces destroyed Russian armored fighting vehicle BTR-82A and killed Russian soldiers. Unspecified fatalities coded as 10.
On 26 March 2022, Russian forces shelled residential areas of Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 27 March 2022, Russian forces shelled residential districts of Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 27 March 2022, Russian forces shelled the Chernihiv region, damaging two schools and numerous residential buildings. Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: On 27 March 2022, Ukrainian forces (of Operational Command 'North'), in their area of operation, captured two Russian 'Tornado-U' armored trucks left by the Russian military following their defeat in the Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).
On 28 March 2022, Russian forces opened fire at the volunteers carrying medicine and food to the city for residents and soldiers near Chernihiv. As a result, several people were injured.

On 28 March 2022, Ukrainian forces clashed with Russian forces in Chernihiv region. Ukrainian forces destroyed two Russian 'Tiger' armored vehicles, 'Ural' truck and a T-72 tank. Around twenty-two Russian soldiers were killed.
On 28 March 2022, Russian forces shelled residential areas of Chernihiv. One child was killed, further casualties unknown.
On 29 March 2022, Russian forces continued to block and shell Chernihiv trying to destroy Ukrainian military infrastructure. Casualties unknown.

On 29 March 2022, following clashes with Russian forces, Ukrainian forces (of Operational Command 'North'), in their area of operation, destroyed 4 units of Russian military equipment i.e., 1 'Ural' truck with ammo, 1 'T-72' tank, 2 'Tigr' armored vehicles and killed up to 22 Russian soldiers. Also, 8 pieces of Russian equipment were damaged, 1 'Ural' truck with rations captured (coded to Chernihiv).
On 30 March 2022, the Russian forces continued to fire artillery in the direction of Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

On 30 March 2022, following clashes with Russian forces, Ukrainian forces (of Operational Command 'North'), in their area of operation, destroyed 5 units of Russian military equipment i.e., 'Ural' trucks, armored vehicles, self-propelled howitzer, IFV and damaged 5 more pieces of Russian equipment (coded to Chernihiv). Casualties unknown.
On 31 March 2022, defensive battles continued between the Russian and Ukrainian forces in Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

On 31 March 2022, Russian forces shelled Chernihiv throughout the day. Russian forces hit 2 columns of buses with volunteers inside that were delivering humanitarian aid at the entrance of Chernihiv as a result of which 2 civilians died and 4 were wounded.
On 31 March 2022, Ukrainian forces destroyed a column of Russian forces in the Chernihiv region. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 1 April 2022, Russian forces shot down Ukrainian drones near Chernihiv. In total, 8 Ukrainian drones were downed near Chernihiv, Donetsk, Lysychansk, and Novomykhailivka during the day.
On 1 April 2022, Russian forces shelled the oncology department of a hospital in Chernihiv. Three people, including two employees, were injured.
On 1 April 2022, Ukrainian forces clashed with Russian forces in the Chernihiv region. A group of partisans managed to destroy a Russian military column during its retreat. Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: Around 1 April 2022 (beginning of month), in the de-occupied territories of the Chernihiv region, Ukrainian forces seized in total 18 units of Russian military equipment, including IFVs, APCs and towed-artillery from retreating Russian soldiers. All captured military hardware has been transferred to the Ukrainian military (coded to Chernihiv city).
On 3 April 2022, Russian military forces shelled Ukrainian forces south of Chernihiv with the support of a drone. Casualties unknown.

Mass grave: On 6 April 2022, hundreds of civilians were buried in a mass grave in Chernihiv. They are presumed victims of the fighting in Chernihiv of the previous days. Fatalities coded as 0. Fatalities are coded to separate events when verified.
Defusal: On 7 April 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists found and defused one fragment of Russian 'Tochka-U' missile with multiple cluster munition inside it in Chernihiv (Chernihiv).
Interception: On 8 April 2022, Ukraine forces intercepted a Russian Tochka-U missile in Chernihiv region.
Displacement: On 11 April 2022, about 16 civilians evacuated from Chernihiv to Cherkasy.
Defusal: On 19 April 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists safely removed and defused around 678 UXOs in the Chernihiv region.
Defusal: On 20 April 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists found and removed a Russian FAB-500 unexploded aerial bomb at the city Stadium in Chernihiv (Chernihiv).

Defusal: On 21 April 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists conducted a controlled detonation of unexploded Russian aerial bomb under the water near the bridge on Desna River near Chernihiv (Chernihiv).
Around 22 April 2022 (as reported), an employee of Ukrzaliznytsia (State Railway Company) died in an explosion of an anti-personnel mine planted by Russian forces in Chernihiv region.

Around 28 April 2022 (week of), a local civilian man was killed in an explosion as he accidentally activated an anti-personnel mine (POM-2) planted by Russian military near Chernihiv (Chernihiv). His body was found by Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists during de-mining works on 5 May 2022, they also found four more mines near his body and defused them.

Weapons seizure: On 8 May 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists found several munition boxes with 82mm mortar rounds and IVF's 30mm projectiles stored by Russian forces at the warehouse near Chernihiv (Chernihiv). All found ammunition were transferred to Ukrainian military.
Defusal: On 9 May 2022, Ukrainian State Emergency Service specialists began clearing Chernihiv-Kyiv highway of mines and UXOs (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region).
On 11 May 2022, Russian forces fired mortars at the border regions of Chernihiv region. There were no casualties.
On 16 May 2022, Russian forces shelled border settlements in Chernihiv region. There were no casualties.
On 31 May 2022, Russian forces fired mortars at the border settlements in Chernihiv region. Casualties unknown.

Weapons seizure: Around 6 June 2022 (as reported), the Security Service seized from three people recruited by Russian special services (coded as GRU) sniper rifles, RPG-18, grenades, ammunition, night vision devices, and assault rifles in residences and garages near Chernihiv, Chernihiv. The men likely aided Russian recon and sabotage groups.

Defusal: On 4 July 2022, during a two day de-mining activity, State Emergency Service specialists safely removed and disposed of four unexploded Russian MLRS 'Uragan' rockets from the public beach on the Desna River in Chernihiv (Chernihiv).

Weapons seizure: On 12 July 2022, Ukrainian Security Service forces seized a large cache of Russian weapons, ammunition and explosives in abandoned buildings in Chernihivskyi district (coded to Chernihiv). All weapons seized were transferred to Ukrainian forces.
On 15 July 2022, two adolescents went to walk in the woods and accidentally activated an unknown explosive device in Chernihivskyi district (coded to Chernihiv). They were hospitalized.

Weapons seizure: On 15 July 2022, Ukrainian Security Service forces seized a large cache of Russian weapons, ammunition and explosives in abandoned buildings in Chernihivskyi, Prylutskyi and Koryukivskyi districts of Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv). Some caches were booby trapped but safely defused first by State Emergency Service sappers. All weapons seized were transferred to Ukrainian forces.

Weapons seizure: On 21 July 2022, Ukrainian Security Service forces seized a large cache of Russian weapons, ammunition and explosives in an abandoned building in Chernihivskyi district (coded to Chernihiv). All weapons seized were transferred to Ukrainian forces.
Interception: On 24 August 2022, Ukrainian forces shot down 2 Russian UAVs, likely Orlan-10, over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region) during the day.
Interception: On 7 September 2022, State Border Service of Ukraine sniper shot down a Russian UAV over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region).
Interception: On 17 October 2022, Ukrainian air defence forces shot down a Russian drone in Chernihiv region.

On 19 October 2022, Russian forces launched a rocket strike at Chernihiv; though the rocket was intercepted, it landed amid the industrial area, hitting an enterprise. 5 civilians were injured, 3 of them were hospitalized.
Defusal: On 19 October 2022, Ukrainian emergency service specialists carried out a controlled detonation of explosive elements (UXO) in the Chernihiv region. No casualties.
Interception: On 22 October 2022, Ukrainian forces shot down a Russian rocket over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).

Weapons seizure: On 20 December 2022, Security Service of Ukraine found and seized a cache of weapons in Chernihiv region, that Russian forces left while retreating. The ammunition included: dozens of boxes with rockets and ammunition for anti-tank weapons, about 300 pieces of artillery ammunition, including for MLRS Grad, more than 100 units of charges for hand-held anti-tank grenade launchers, RPG-26 anti-tank grenades and over a thousand rounds of ammunition of various calibers.
Interception: On 27 February 2023, Ukrainian air defence systems intercepted three Russian Shahed drones over Chernihiv region.
Interception: On 8 March 2023, Ukrainian forces shot down a Russian Shahed-136 drone over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region).
On 17 March 2023, a Ukrainian farmer was seriously injured when his tractor hit a Russian landmine in the Chernihiv region.
On 19 March 2023, a 50-year-old local man was killed in an explosion of an unknown explosive device (UXO) at the residential yard in Chernihiv (Chernihiv).
Interception: On 22 March 2023, Ukrainian forces shot down a Russian Orlan-10 drone over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region).
Interception: On 28 March 2023, at night, Ukrainian State Border Guard Service shot down a Russian drone over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).

Interception: Around 19 April 2023 (week of), Ukrainian border guard forces shot down a Russian Shahed-136 UAV over Chernihiv region near the Russian border (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region). The UAV was found on April 19.
On 21 April 2023, Russian forces conducted at least one drone strike in Chernihiv oblast (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv). Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 28 May 2023, Ukrainian forces shot down a Russian 'Shahed' drone over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).
Interception: On 4 June 2023, State Border Guard Service shot down a Russian 'Shahed' drone over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv)

On 19 August 2023, Russian forces launched 'Iskander' missile at an opera theatre, where a drone exhibition took place, in Chernihiv. 7 civilians were killed, including a child, and 156 civilians were injured.

Defusal: On 25 August 2023, Ukrainian Emergency service specialists cleared 157 hectares of land and safely defused and destroyed nearly 1,792 explosive elements in the area of Operational Command 'North' (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv region).
On 28 August 2023, a car with 4 civilians hit a mine planted by Russian forces in Chernihiv region. A married couple died and 2 children were injured.
On 9 September 2023, Russian forces shelled near Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.
On 9 October 2023, 1 civilian was injured in an explosion of an unidentified explosive device in Chernihiv.
On 14 October 2023, Russian forces shelled near Chernihiv. Casualties unknown.

On 13 November 2023, a 18-year-old adolescent was injured in an explosion as he carelessly handled an unknown explosive device similar to a detonating fuse that went off in his hands in Chernihiv (Chernihiv). It is suspected that he found the device and tried to dismantle it. He was admitted to a hospital with hand injuries.

On 18 November 2023, Russian air forces carried out a 'Shahed-136' drone strike at Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones. Civilian infrastructure was damaged. No casualties.
Interception: On 25 November 2023, Ukrainian forces shot down 4 Russian drones over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv). Civilian infrastructure was damaged.

Defusal: On 29 December 2023, Ukrainian Emergency service specialists defused a hand grenade 'F-1' found on a bench with a fuse at the residential area in Chernihiv (Chernihiv region).

On 3 January 2024, a local civilian man was killed in an explosion of an unknown explosive device in a basement of a residential building in Chernihiv (Chernihiv region). It is suspected that he found the device and accidentally activated it.
On 13 January 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missile, as the result of falling missile debris 23 private houses were damaged in Chernihiv. No casualties.

On 13 February 2024, an explosion of an unknown explosive element occurred in a private car in Chernihiv (Chernihiv). As a result of the explosion, two civilians (a man and a woman) were severely injured. The woman later died in a hospital.
Interception: On 18 February 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down 2 Russian 'Shahed-136/131' drones over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).

On 17 April 2024, Russian Forces fired on Chernihiv, Chernihiv, with 3 Iskander missiles, destroying a social infrastructure building, damaging 17 apartment buildings, a hospital, an educational facility and dozens of cars. 18 civilians were killed, 89 civilians were injured.

Interception: On 31 August 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missiles and drones over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).

The man was also suspected of collecting intelligence about Ukrainian armed forces.

Interception: On 30 September 2024, Russian Forces launched one Iskander-M ballistic missile, one Kh-59/69 cruise missile, one Kh-31P anti-radar missile and 73 Shahed-136/131 drones against targets in Ukraine. Interception: On 7 October 2024, Russian Forces launched more than 80 drones and missiles, including one Iskander-M ballistic missile, a Kh-59 cruise missile, and another missile of an unknown type, and an unspecified number of strike drones, likely Shaheds-136/131 at targets in Ukraine. Some of the drones and missiles were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces in Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv). No casualties.

On 13 October 2024, Russian air forces launched missiles at Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv). Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones. Casualties unknown.

No casualties.

Interception: On 17 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones above Chernihiv Oblast (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv.) 22 Russian drones were shot down and 27 were disrupted and likely destroyed by EW systems in Sumy, Kyiv, Poltava, Chernihiv, Zhytomyr, Mykolaiv, Cherkasy, Odesa, and Ternopil Oblasts.

Interception: On 26 October 2024, Ukrainian State Border Guard servicemen shot down in Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv, Chernihiv) a Russian UAV loaded with explosives, which fell on the ground and exploded before it could reach the target.

Interception: On 12 November 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Chernihiv region (coded to Chernihiv).

The man was also arrested for monitoring military objects and planning to produce explosive devices to target military soldiers.

The man was arrested in November 2024 and suspected of planning using explosive device and kamikaze drones against the Ukrainian military.

notes: On 31 December 2023, Russian air forces carried out drone strikes near Kamianets-Podilskyi, Khmelnytskyi. Casualties unknown.
On 21 November 2022, Ukrainian forces shelled Askaniia-Nova, Kherson region. Casualties unknown.

Around 16 November 2023 (as reported), according to local sources, Ukrainian air forces carried out two missile strikes with 'Storm Shadow' and destroyed a Russian radio electronic warfare system and military equipment stationed inside the premises in Russian-held Askaniia-Nova (Kherson). Casualties unknown.
On 24 February 2022, military forces of Russia launched a rocket attack on Uman, Cherkasy. As a result, one civilian was killed and five were wounded. The town began evacuation of its residents.
On 13 March 2022, Russian air force fired missiles at Uman, Cherkasy. Casualties unknown.
On 25 April 2022, Russian forces launched a rocket attack in Uman, Cherkasy. Casualties unknown.
On 8 August 2022, debris of the intercepted Russian rocket crashed upon civilian infrastructure in the Uman district (coded to Uman, Cherkasy). 2 civilians were wounded, 1 of them died in a hospital.
On 16 September 2022, Ukrainian forces intercepted a Russian missile near Uman, Cherkasy which crashed and damaged several homes. Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 19 October 2022, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian Shahed-136 drones near Uman, Cherkasy region. In total, 5 drones were neutralized near Uman and Kobleve.

On 28 April 2023, Russian forces launched a missile at Uman, Cherkasy, hitting a residential building. 18 people were wounded and 23 civilians were killed. Another civilian died from injuries in August 2023 bringing total fatalities to 24.
On 8 June 2023, Russian navy fired 'Kalibr' missiles at an industrial object and a car wash service in Uman, Cherkasy. 10 civilians were injured.
On 1 October 2023, Russian air forces carried out drone strikes at Uman, Cherkasy. Civilian infrastructure was damaged. 1 civilian was injured.

On 12 October 2023, Russian kamikaze drones attacked Uman, Cherkasy. According to Ukrainian sources, one drone hit an open terrain, another was shot down by the Ukrainian military. According to Russian sources, a Ukrainian fuel depot in the Uman airport was hit (A2 is not coded as neither version could be verified). There were no casualties.
Interception: On 12 December 2023, Ukrainian military forces intercepted a Russian kamikaze-drone over the Uman district (coded to Uman, Cherkasy).
Interception: On 7 February 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down three Russian (Shahed type) drones over Umanskyi district (coded to Uman, Cherkasy region).
Interception: On 10 March 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian 'Shahed' drones near Uman, Cherkasy.

Property destruction: Around 15 May 2024 (month of), a 20-year-old man recruited by Russian special services (coded as FSB) set fired to electric substations, railway switchboards, and objects of energy infrastructure in Uman district, Cherkasy. He was arrested in July 2024 and sentenced to 15 years in prison.

Property destruction: Around 26 July 2024 (as reported), according to the SBU, a 20-year-old man set fire to railway cabinets and eight substations during May-July 2024 in the Uman district (coded to Uman, Cherkasy), following commands from Russia. He was arrested around 26 July 2024 during another arson.

Property destruction: Around 15 August 2024 (month of), according to the SBU, a 25-year-old man set fire to a military vehicle under repair in Uman district of Cherkasy region, following commands from a Russian individual. The man was quickly arrested and is suspected of planning or conducting arsons of other vehicles of the military and the border service.

Property destruction: Around 31 August 2024 (end of month), according to the Security Service of Ukraine, a 21-year-old man and a 16-year-old teenager set fire to a military vehicle in Uman, Cherkasy, following commands from the Russian special services (coded as FSB). The men were shortly arrested after setting fire to another military vehicle in September 2024 (coded separately).

Property destruction: Around 5 September 2024 (beginning of month), according to the Security Service of Ukraine, a 21-year-old man and a 16-year-old teenager set fire to a military vehicle in Uman, Cherkasy, following commands from the Russian special services (coded as FSB). The men also set fire to a military vehicle in August 2024 (coded separately).
On 19 October 2024, Russian forces launched an air strike at Uman community (coded as Uman, Cherkasy region). One civilian was killed.

On 5 December 2024, according to Russian sources, at night, Russian aerospace forces carried out (likely) cruise missile strikes at the airport in Uman, Cherkasy. As a result, the Russian forces struck the ammo depot of the 40th Ukrainian tactical brigade as well as one MiG-29 and one SU-27 jet aircrafts at the territory. Casualties unknown.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 13 April 2018, in Bakhchysarai of the occupied Crimea, Russian security forces conducted searches in the houses of the Crimean Tatars, Seydamet Mustafayev and Riza Muzhdabaev. Mustafayev was taken away by the law enforcers after the search. In addition, one Crimean Tatar fainted after being hit with batons and was taken by an ambulance. Four Crimean Tatars, who came to support those who were searched, were detained by the police.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 28 June 2018, the Russian FSB detained and tortured a Crimean Tatar individual close to the exiled Crimean Tatar leader and MP Mustafa Dzhemilyev in Bakhchysarai, Crimea, in an attempt to extract confession regarding taking a part in an arson attack on the home of the current Crimean Mufti.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 15 September 2022, explosions, presumably as a result of the Ukrainian missile strike, were heard in Bakhchysarai, Crimea. Casualties unknown.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 1 March 2023, Ukrainian forces launched a drone strike at Russian positions near Bakhchysarai, Crimea, in the vicinity of a Russian military base. The Russian air defence systems were likely engaged as well. Casualties unknown.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 22 September 2023, Ukrainian forces conducted a strike, likely with air-launched Storm Shadow missiles, on Russian forces near Bakhchysarai, Crimea. Casualties unknown.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 5 March 2024, Russian police conducted searches against the homes of Crimean Tatar activists and Muslim religious figures in occupied Bakhchysarai, Crimea. Several of the activists and religious figures, whose houses were searched, were detained, some of them on terrorism charges.

unesco_site: Bagesaray Palace of the Crimean Khans
notes: On 29 August 2024, Federal Security Service of Russia abducted a mother of political prisoners, a Crimean Tatar, in Bakhchysarai, Crimea. She was later released under obligation to appear.

On 5 March 2018, three minors killed a gay person in Mykolaiv. Three residents of Luhansk region, age from 16 to 17, found a male LGBT victim on a dating site and made him intimate offers. At his home they filmed an intimate video, threatening to post it for the public, and afterwards drowned the victim in the bathtub.

On 20 July 2019, two unidentified individuals beat a parliamentary candidate in Mykolaiv. The candidate sustained injuries.

On 30 November 2019, unidentified individuals beat and sprayed unknown substance in the face of a local journalist near his house in Mykolaiv. The journalist was hospitalised with damage to his eyes, mouth and trachea.
Around 15 March 2020 (month of), police officers heavily beat a man in a police department in Mykolaiv after they had misappropriated his cryptocurrency mining equipment.

Property destruction: On 16 July 2020, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of the head of the regional branch of National Corps in Mykolaiv. A group of people calling themselves separatists from Odessa claimed responsibility.

Property destruction: On 8 October 2020, at night, unidentified individuals set fire to a car of a candidate to the local city council from Servant of the People party in Mykolaiv. The car was destroyed, no injuries were reported.

Russian forces shelled at the military facility in the city. 9 servicemen were killed, including a Ukrainian journalist who joined military, 19 were wounded and 8 reported missing. Ukrainian forces repelled Russian forces from the airport. Russian forces also shelled the port in Mykolaiv. Further casualties unknown.

On 27 June 2024, Russian forces launched a ballistic missile strike at Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv region. Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 29 June 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).

On 2 July 2024, Russian forces conducted strikes using 253 FPV drones, 8 Lancet drones, and 260 other drones across the Southern Front in Dnipropetrovsk, Zaporizhia, Kherson, and Mykolaiv Oblasts (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv). Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 5 July 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down an unknown number of Russian Shahed-136 drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv region).
Interception: On 6 July 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv). No casualties.

Interception: On 12 July 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down an unknown number of Russian Shahed-136 drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv region). No casualties.

On 20 July 2024, Russian forces launched ballistic missiles near Mykolaiv. Civilian infrastructure and 2 private houses were damaged. 2 civilians were injured.
Interception: On 21 July 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missiles and drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).

Property destruction: On 9 August 2024, according to the prosecutors, three teenagers aged 16, 13, 14, set on fire a car of a serviceman in Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv, following orders coming from Telegram (likely coming from Russia). The boys are also suspected of setting fire to two service pickups of the marine forces, brought to Mykolaiv for repairs, and of preparing an arson of local administrative building of the recruitment center.
Interception: On 11 August 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down 7 Russian drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).
Interception: On 13 August 2024, Ukrainian military forces intercepted 30 Russian kamikaze-drones, some over the Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv).

Interception: On 19 August 2024, Russian Forces launched 19 Shahed-136/131 drones against targets in Ukraine. Ukrainian Forces intercepted some of the drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv). No casualties.

Interception: On 25 August 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian missiles and drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).

On 2 September 2024, Russian forces conducted a ballistic missile strike on an unidentified target in Mykolaiv Oblast (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv.) Casualties unknown.

Property destruction: Around 2 September 2024 (as reported), according to the Security Service and the Police, a 35-year-old man, together with two other men, aged 25 and 30, all previously convicted, set fire to five military vehicles in Kherson (coded separately), Mykolaiv, and Odesa (coded separately), following commands from Russian special services. The police seized storage units, two handguns, a machine gun, 12 grenades and ammunition from the suspects.
On 3 September 2024, Russian forces launched a missile strike onto Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 1 October 2024, Russian Forces launched 32 Shahed-136/131 drones against targets in Ukraine. Ukrainian Forces intercepted 29 drones, some of them over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv). No casualties.

On 4 October 2024, explosions were heard (likely as a result of Russian missile attack) in the Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv). Casualties unknown.
Interception: On 6 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).

Some of the drones and missiles were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces in Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv). No casualties.

Interception: On 8 October 2024, Russian Forces launched 19 attack drones at targets in Ukraine. 18 drones were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces, some of them over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv) and one more attack drone was diverted to Russia. No casualties.
On 9 October 2024, explosions were heard in Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv, likely due to Russian missile strike. Casualties unknown.

On 10 October 2024, Russian forces conducted ballistic missile strikes on Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv. Infrastructure and civilian homes were targetted. Two civilians were wounded.
On 14 October 2024, Russian Forces launched drone strikes and shelled Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv, with missiles and artillery. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 15 October 2024, Russian Forces launched 17 unspecified strike drones (suspected Shahed-136/131 drones) at targets in Ukraine. 12 drones were intercepted by Ukrainian Forces, some of them over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv) and 4 more attack drone became lost in Ukraine due to Ukrainian electronic warfare countermeasures. No casualties.

On 15 October 2024, Russian Forces struck Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv, with S-300 missiles, damaging at least 8 educational institutions, 2 medical facilities, 4 retail buildings and 56 residential buildings. 1 civilians was killed and 23 civilians were injured.

On 17 October 2024, Russian forces conducted a strike with an unidentified weapons system (coded as air/drone strike) on a power infrastructure facility in Mykolaiv Oblast (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv.) The attack resulted in blackouts in the region. Casualties unknown.

Interception: On 17 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones above Mykolaiv Oblast (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv.) 22 Russian drones were shot down and 27 were disrupted and likely destroyed by EW systems in Sumy, Kyiv, Poltava, Chernihiv, Zhytomyr, Mykolaiv, Cherkasy, Odesa, and Ternopil Oblasts.
Interception: On 20 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).

No casualties.

Interception: On 24 October 2024, Ukrainian forces engaged Russian drones above Mykolaiv Oblast (coded to Mykolaiv, Mykolaiv.) 40 Russian drones were shot down above Odesa, Mykolaiv, Dnipropetrovsk, Vinnytsia, Zhytomyr, Khmelnytskyi, Cherkasy, Kirovgrad, Kyiv, Poltava, and Chernihiv Oblasts.

Interception: On 27 October 2024, Ukrainian forces shot down Russian drones over Mykolaiv region (coded to Mykolaiv).
